titlestmt.titleproper: RG 079:005, Department of Environmental Protection: Air, Waste and Water
titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory of Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2008 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on February 01, 2008

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Department of Environmental Protection air waste and water records
did.abstract: Air, Waste and Water records include: Deputy Commissioner; Planning and Standards; Bureau of Water Management; Bureau of Air Management; Inland Water Resources.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: With the creation of the Department of Environmental Protection in 1971, the Environmental Quality Division was given the mission of abating the pollution of the water, air and land of the state.1 Now known as the Bureau of Air, Waste and Water, this part of the Dept. of Environmental Protection has always been based on media (transport of pollutants, i.e. water and air) and business (source of pollutants, i.e. waste, pesticides, etc.). The functions of permitting, inspection, enforcement, and monitoring have been subsets of the primary structure.2

list.head: Endnotes
list.item: 1Press release, November 22, 1971, RG 079:001, Department of Ennvironmental Protection, Commissioner Arthur J. Rocque, Jr., Accession 2005-009, Organizational Evaluation, Box 6, Folder "First DEP Org Dan Lufkin Documents".
2Untitled and undated document, RG 079:001, Ennvironmental Protection, Commissioner Arthur J. Rocque, Jr., Accession 2005-009, Organizational Evaluation, Box 6, Folder "Historic Org Charts".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Included here are records from the Deputy Commissioner, 1972-2004; Planning and Standards, 1970-1973; Bureau of Water Management, 1920-1979 that includes records from the Permitting, Enforcement, and Remediation Division; Bureau of Air Management, 1975-1992; and Inland Water Resources, 1939-2013 that includes records from the New England River Basins Commission, 1966-1975, the Connecticut Soil Advisory Committee, 1948-1974, 8 volumes of survey notes of Connecticut waterways, 1939-1941, and 3 dvds of the Municipal Inland Wetland Commissioners Training Program, 2007-2013.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series numbers have been assigned within RG 079 in its entirety and therefore the series described here are not numbered consecutively.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
Additional Department of Environmental Protection records can be found in:
RG 079:001, Central Office
RG 079:004, Aerial photographs, see the .
RG 079:016, Natural Resources and Outdoor Recreation
RG 079:018, Office of Indian Affairs

As well in these predecessor departments, boards, and commissions:
RG 079:003, Board of Fisheries and Game
RG 079:017, State Park and Forest Commission
RG 079:022, Forestry Department
RG 079:023, Water Resources Commission
RG 079:026, State Harbor Commissioners for New Haven Harbor

Other record groups:
RG 002:29, General Assembly Task Forces, Environment Committee Task Forces
RG 005, Office of the Governor contain files about the Department of Environmental Protection and its predecessors.
RG 015, Office of Policy and Management for records of grant programs transferred out of the Department of Agriculture.
RG 089, Department of Transportation contains the major statewide areil photographic surveys.
RG 098, Department of Agriculture

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.
